Docs.summary: Gets or sets the list of facet expressions to apply to the search query. Each facet expression contains a field name, optionally followed by a comma-separated list of name:value pairs.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to fetch the total count of results. Default is false. Setting this value to true may have a performance impact. Note that the count returned is an approximation.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a number between 0 and 100 indicating the percentage of the index that must be covered by a search query in order for the query to be reported as a success. This parameter can be useful for ensuring search availability even for services with only one replica. The default is 100.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.Collections.Generic.IList<string> OrderBy { get; set; }
.property instance class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<string> OrderBy
Public Property OrderBy As IList(Of String)
member this.OrderBy : System.Collections.Generic.IList<string> with get, set

public: property System::Collections::Generic::IList<System::String ^> ^ OrderBy { System::Collections::Generic::IList<System::String ^> ^ get(); void set(System::Collections::Generic::IList<System::String ^> ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the list of OData $orderby expressions by which to sort the results. Each expression can be either a field name or a call to the geo.distance() function. Each expression can be followed by asc to indicate ascending, and desc to indicate descending. The default is ascending order. Ties will be broken by the match scores of documents. If no OrderBy is specified, the default sort order is descending by document match score. There can be at most 32 Orderby clauses.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the syntax of the search query. The default is 'simple'. Use 'full' if your query uses the Lucene query syntax. Possible values for this property include: 'simple', 'full'.

MemberSignature.Value: public Nullable<int> Skip { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.Nullable`1<int32> Skip
Public Property Skip As Nullable(Of Integer)
member this.Skip : Nullable<int> with get, set
public: property Nullable<int> Skip { Nullable<int> get(); void set(Nullable<int> value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of search results to skip. This value cannot be greater than 100,000. If you need to scan documents in sequence, but cannot use Skip due to this limitation, consider using OrderBy on a totally-ordered key and Filter with a range query instead.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of search results to retrieve. This can be used in conjunction with Skip to implement client-side paging of search results.
